Tutorials

Causal Inference Tutorials

Comprehensive learning resources for causality and causal inference methods

Visit CausalAtlas.org

All my causal inference tutorials, courses, and educational materials are hosted on CausalAtlas.org – a comprehensive platform dedicated to advancing knowledge in causality and causal inference.

CausalAtlas.org

Your complete resource for causal inference methods, from foundational concepts to advanced techniques. Free and open access for the global research community.

Visit CausalAtlas.org →

What You'll Find on CausalAtlas.org

Comprehensive Tutorials

Step-by-step guides from DAGs and counterfactuals to advanced g-methods and sensitivity analysis.

Code Examples

Practical implementations in R, Python, and other statistical software with real-world datasets.

Research Methods

Propensity scores, instrumental variables, causal discovery, mediation analysis, and more.

For All Levels

Resources for students, researchers, epidemiologists, data scientists, and policy analysts.

Real Applications

Case studies from epidemiology, economics, social sciences, and healthcare research.

Free & Open Access

All resources freely available to support the global research community.

Topics Covered

Comprehensive coverage of causal inference methods and applications

Causal Graphs & DAGs

Directed acyclic graphs, d-separation, backdoor criterion, front-door criterion, and graphical identification strategies.

Propensity Score Methods

Matching, stratification, inverse probability weighting, and doubly robust estimation for confounding control.

G-Methods for Time-Varying Treatments

G-formula, g-estimation, marginal structural models for complex longitudinal data with time-varying confounding.

Instrumental Variables

Two-stage least squares, weak instruments, Mendelian randomization, and natural experiments.

Causal Discovery

Constraint-based algorithms, score-based methods, and hybrid approaches for learning causal structures from data.

Mediation & Moderation

Direct and indirect effects, controlled direct effects, natural direct/indirect effects, and effect modification.

Questions or Feedback?

Have questions about causal inference methods or feedback on the resources?

Visit CausalAtlas.org Get in Touch

Geoffrey Manda

PhD Research Fellow in Biostatistics & Causal Inference at Queen Mary University of London. Advancing statistical methods for global health research.

Editor, CausalAtlas.org
